SEARCH
Package controller.medication

Class MedicationManager

java.lang.Object
controller.medication.MedicationManager
public class MedicationManager extends Object
The MedicationManager class provides utility methods for managing medications and its inventory.

      public MedicationManager()

  • Method Details

    • getMedicationsById

      public static Medication getMedicationsById(String medicationID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Retrieves a medication by its ID from the database. This method fetches a medication record from the database using its unique medication ID. If the medication is not found, a `ModelNotFoundException` is thrown.
      Parameters:
      medicationID - The unique ID of the medication to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The medication object corresponding to the given medicationID.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If the medication with the provided ID does not exist in the database.

    • addMedication

      public static void addMedication(Medication medication) throws ModelAlreadyExistsException
      Adds a new medication to the database. This method adds a new medication record to the database. If the medication already exists, a `ModelAlreadyExistsException` is thrown.
      Parameters:
      medication - The medication object to be added to the database.
      Throws:
      ModelAlreadyExistsException - If a medication with the same ID already exists in the database.

    • updateMedication

      public static void updateMedication(Medication medication) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Updates an existing medication in the database. This method updates the details of an existing medication in the database. If the medication to be updated does not exist, a `ModelNotFoundException` is thrown.
      Parameters:
      medication - The medication object containing the updated details.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If the medication to update is not found in the database.

    • isRepositoryEmpty

      public static boolean isRepositoryEmpty()
      Checks if the medication repository is empty. This method checks if there are any medications stored in the database.
      Returns:
      `true` if the medication repository is empty, `false` otherwise.

    • loadMedication

      public static void loadMedication() throws ModelAlreadyExistsException
      Loads medication data from a CSV file and adds it to the medication database. This method reads medication data from the file located at `./resources/Medicine_List.csv`. For each row in the CSV, it creates a new `Medication` object with the medication ID (generated using `UUID`), name, stock level, and low stock level alert. The method then attempts to add the new medication to the database. If the medication already exists in the database, a `ModelAlreadyExistsException` is caught and an appropriate message is printed. The CSV file is expected to have the following structure: 1. Medication ID (which is ignored as a new one is generated) 2. Medication Name 3. Medication Stock 4. Low Stock Level Alert
      Throws:
      ModelAlreadyExistsException - If a medication already exists in the database with the same ID.

    • getAllMedications

      public static List<Medication> getAllMedications()
      Retrieves all medications from the medication database. This method fetches and returns a list of all medications stored in the medication database.
      Returns:
      A list of `Medication` objects representing all medications in the database.

    • updateMedicationStock

      public static void updateMedicationStock(String medicationID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Updates the stock level of a specific medication by increasing it by 10 units. This method attempts to retrieve the medication by its ID and increase its stock by 10 units. If the medication is found, the stock is updated, and the `Medication` object is saved back to the database. If the medication with the given ID is not found in the database, an error message is printed indicating that the medication was not found.
      Parameters:
      medicationID - The ID of the medication whose stock level is to be updated.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If the medication with the specified ID is not found in the database.

    • reduceMedicationStock

      public static void reduceMedicationStock(String medicationID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Reduces the stock level of a specific medication by 1 unit. This method attempts to retrieve the medication by its ID and decreases its stock by 1 unit. If the medication is found, the stock is updated, and the `Medication` object is saved back to the database. If the medication with the given ID is not found in the database, an error message is printed indicating that the medication was not found.
      Parameters:
      medicationID - The ID of the medication whose stock level is to be reduced.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If the medication with the specified ID is not found in the database.

    • deleteMedication

      public static void deleteMedication(String medicationID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Deletes a medication from the database based on the provided medication ID. This method attempts to remove a medication from the database using its ID. If the medication is found in the database, it is removed successfully. If the medication with the specified ID does not exist, an error message is printed indicating that the medication was not found.
      Parameters:
      medicationID - The ID of the medication to be deleted.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If the medication with the specified ID does not exist in the database.

    • getMedicationsByIDs

      public static ArrayList<Medication> getMedicationsByIDs(ArrayList<String> medicationIDs) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Retrieves a list of medications from the database based on a list of medication IDs. This method takes a list of medication IDs and attempts to fetch the corresponding medication objects from the database. If a medication ID does not exist in the database, a ModelNotFoundException will be thrown for that specific medication ID.
      Parameters:
      medicationIDs - The list of medication IDs for which the medications need to be fetched.
      Returns:
      A list of Medication objects corresponding to the provided IDs.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If any medication ID is not found in the database.

    • getListOfMedicationNamesByIDs

      public static ArrayList<String> getListOfMedicationNamesByIDs(List<String> medicationIDs)
      Retrieves the names of medications based on a list of medication IDs. This method takes a list of medication IDs and attempts to fetch the corresponding medication objects from the database. It then collects and returns the names of these medications. If any medication ID does not exist in the database, an error message is printed for that ID.
      Parameters:
      medicationIDs - The list of medication IDs for which the medication names need to be fetched.
      Returns:
      A list of medication names corresponding to the provided medication IDs.

    • getLowStockMedicationInventory

      public static ArrayList<Medication> getLowStockMedicationInventory()
      Retrieves a list of medications that are at or below their low stock level alert. This method checks for medications whose stock levels are at or below the low stock level threshold and returns a list of these medications. It uses the medication IDs retrieved from `getLowStockIDs` and attempts to fetch the corresponding `Medication` objects. If any medication is not found, the exception is caught and the stack trace is printed.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of `Medication` objects that have low stock.
